text: everyone is alum here today I will make
yeah but we are pomelo pudding from the
name you might expect it to have
somewhat citrus taste right but then
you're going to be disappointed because
the only part of the pomelo that's used
in this dessert is the pig which is the
white part of the Rye so if you have
finished the fruit don't throw away the
Rye save it to make this amazingly my
watering dessert let's begin first of
all you want to peel the pomelo just cut
the cap off the top of the pomelo and
then cut vertical slices down the side
of it about one inch into the right pull
the slices off the fruit and then did
your finger underneath the slices to
pull each one firmly away but the
pudding today we only use the white part
of the right which feels like spiral
form so pure way the green parts try to
remove the green part as much as
possible otherwise it would be bitter
cut the white part into dices this job
is really mesmerizing and I really love
to doing this when I was a kid for this
recipe you should use only half the RAI
of one pomelo next mix 2 tsp of salt and
a dash of water with the big dices and
leave with your hands for about 5
minutes and then rinse well
then squeeze out the excess water is
very spongy and apply a lot of water
you need to repeat this step and list
five times until it doesn't taste any
bitter then mix away 50 grams sugar and
leave for about one hour next rings 100
gram of peeled split mung beans and so
in water for about 1 hour to soften and
then you can trim or cook in the rice
cooker until soft for about 15 minutes
next toss the pomelo dices with 4 tbsp
of tapioca starch that's about 60 gram
and toss well so it's coat around every
dices then in another bowl combine 60
gram of tapioca starch with 1 cup of
water stir well to dissolve in a sauce
pan twin cock-ups a 1 liter of water to
a boil and cook the pomelo dices for
about 2 minutes or until they float to
the surface then remove with a slotted
spoon and transfer to an ice water bowl
then drain and set aside the dice is
gonna turn translucent and looks really
pretty keep the remaining water boiling
in the saucepan and add 200 gram of
sugar and lower the heat to about medium
make sure that you stir again to bring
up the stops except to at the bottom of
the bowl and then stirring the tapioca
starch slurry keep stirring until it
turns thick and translucent finally add
the cooked mung beans and the
translucent pomelo slices the beans
should still be in shape and not crust
which make a really pretty dessert
finally add some vanilla or pomelo
extract if you have and does it you are
done you can top this with some coconut
sauce if you like or as some roasted
peanuts for extra crunch well it smells
so good and it's not too sweet
and it has really amazing texture with
the crunchy piece of the pomelo
I hope you enjoyed today's recipe and
please keep like if you love it and let
me know which other Vietnamese scissors
that you like me to make also follow me
on Instagram and Facebook for more
updates of Vietnamese food thank you for
watching
[Music]
